Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - shame about the noise”
Reviews.Author: 1mat
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel. It had lots of old fashioned charm that really appealed. OK the rooms were a bit smaller than many other faceless US hotels, but that only added to the charm in my view as it represented authentic hotels how they used to be. I have to say the noise was horrendous though, despite being on 8th floor facing away from the main entertainment strip. The problem is that the hotel has absolutey no soundproofing, and it's as though you had windows open fully. Despite fan being on, ear plugs and a pillow over my head, the noise was still disturbing. Don't expect to sleep between 10 pm and 3 am.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel in the heart of the Gaslamp Quarter.”
Reviews.Author: Erin J
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at this hotel when we visited San Diego. It has been purchased by Ramada, but still remains a boutique style hotel. The elevators are the original elevators for the building. They take a little getting used to - you have to open the door and then slide the gate over - but it's a fun experience. There is also a nice rooftop patio - great views of the west and you get a close up of the original Hotel St. James sign. As far as the noise, we had no trouble with noise when we were in our room. Of course we specifically chose this hotel because of the close proximity to the Gaslamp Quarter. As we expected, there were a plethora or restaurants in walking distance and a very happening nightlife. I am always a fan of included breakfast, which this hotel does not provide, but there is a restaurant/bar connected to the lobby and I had some amazing chicken and waffles one morning. We also took advantage of the free airport shuttle provided by the hotel - a definite plus! I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Old Place”
Reviews.Author: lckycnck
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 7 nights at the St. James in the Gaslamp area of San Diego. It was a fantastic experience! The hotel is done in retro elegant decor with chandeliers in the lobby and heavy carpeting and old style furniture. The old elevator is very kinky from the 1800's. It is not for those in a hurry, but it is great. The rooms are a little different than the norm,, but it is well done. We had 2 rooms with a connecting hallway and bathroom. They were great. The only things missing was a bar ridge, but itgs very didn't really different matter. The hotel is situated close to all amenities in the downtown. It is only a couple of blocks from the trolley which makes it very convenient to roam around town. The hotel staff are excellent from the shuttle staff, to the front desk and the restaurant crew. They always had a smile and were very eager to help you. We will definitely return to the St. James when we return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, terrible front desk.”
Reviews.Author: PSUFAN05
Reviews.Content: I stayed five days at this hotel for a conference. What a mistake. The hotel is very old, with tiny rooms that are not comfortable. You almost have no blankets on the bed, certainly no comforter. The hotel is extremely noisy. I stayed there over Saint Patrick's day weekend for the convention and there was a block party outside. When I complained that we should have been informed of this planed event I was told I should have known about it. How am I supposed to know where a block party is going to be held in San Diego when I live on the east coast? Additionally, I booked well in advance and requested a room high up, which they said they normally do for guests staying for several days, I was placed on the second floor. Right next to all the noise. Additionally, my flight was canceled so I was a day delayed getting into the hotel and I was told I would have to pay for the entire night even though I wouldn't be there and it was out of my control, no discount, no I'm sorry that is unfortunate, just I was told that is our policy even though I was staying for four more nights. I would never stay here again. Spend a little more and stay next to the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “clean and...”
Reviews.Author: sylvie d Posted by a Wyndham Hotel Group traveler
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel clean, nicely decorated and friendly staff. Twice had to go back downstairs to get key fixed. Elevators are interesting but almost impossible to use when carrying luggage as the opening is relatively small and both doors have strong springs to close. The bathroom was very clean but the shower quite small. So some really good aspects and some not so good.

Reviews.Title: “Great option in San Diego, tiny rooms though...”
Reviews.Author: velezmar
Reviews.Content: We visited the Ramada Gaslamp last weekend. To begin the location couldn´t be better, walkin distance to bars and restaurants in Gaslamp, Horton Mall and the Trolley. The building is old but well conservated, in fact it doesn´t show it has almost 100 years. The rooms are very tiny, but clean and includes everything you need: LCD TV, wireless internet, coffee station, etc. Something that has to be mentioned is the shower all white and clean, and the quality of towels and linens. Something bad is the elevators, they are a true antique but kinda uncomfortable specially if you´re carrying luggage. Also the staff is friendly, and they help you whateber you need. Definitely would come back to this Ramada!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Theater Goers”
Reviews.Author: Dragonmoe
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the St James and we will be back. We have always had excellent, friendly service. This past stay Clay, from Missouri, was in training. He was very personable and when he didn't know an answer his manager was right there to support him. Yes, the rooms are small. After all, this is a 100 yr old boutique hotel. Love the old elevator! Our rooms and bathrooms have been clean. We've not needed to use the air conditioners, so cannot comment. Additionally, we have stayed in rooms away from the street and have not had any noise problems, not even from adjoining rooms. Brian's24 restaurant next door has great meals and an extensive menu. If this is not to your liking, there are many more nearby eateries to chose from. We only live about 30 miles north of downtown SD, but when we are attending a play or concert downtown we like to stay overnight. This hotel is walking distance from the SD Civic Theater and the Balboa Theater.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay I've ever had”
Reviews.Author: Rob L
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this location. It was EASILY the worst hotel we've ever stayed at. The beds are not queen sized, they are double. There were dead bugs on the floor. The ventilation needs upgrading (having an air conditioner in the window means that all of the noise from the street filters into your room, making it very difficult to sleep). This is the first time I've ever had to leave a hotel early, to get one proper night's sleep. It was very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “"Noise was unbearable..."”
Reviews.Author: canada201008
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, our stay at this hotel single handedly ruined our vacation. We stayed at this hotel for a conference in the middle of March. Our room was on the first floor overlooking the street. The noise was so loud from the street that we couldn't sleep. The second night we were there a bunch of young guests banged on our room door at 1 am thinking that there was a party in our room. The next morning (St. Patty's Day) we awoke to a large tent with adjacent green lanterns being set up steps from the hotel and a stage right beside it. Needless to say we didn't want another sleepless night and moved to another hotel. The rooms were small, and run down. There are much nicer hotels in the gaslamp district for not much more money. Would never return.

Reviews.Title: “I thought maybe I was already home”
Reviews.Author: arv1960
Reviews.Content: hello my name is brent I am from iowa. I stayed at the ramada to on march 11th exited march 12th had an awesome stay. the staff at the ramada was very friendly very courteous and the restaurant joining the ramada brian's 24 was an awesome place to eat. I believe the young man that check me in his name was dennis very very polite young man he needed help but was also training a new employee which was very helpful. there was a couple of other young men I did not know their names they were very good at their jobs to . a very nice place to stay comfortable and was not noisy. I cannot forget my valet driver Hugo, he come up to my room took care of my bagage at 430 in the morning loaded my bags in the van and we started our way toward the airport that guy made me laugh he was hilarious that alone will make me come back and stay there again . the whole staff at the ramada is very friendly specially Hugo the valet driver he really makes you feel welcome sincerely Brent Arvidson 1657 Kent Church Rd Brooklyn Iowa 52211

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms ~ Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mburton0000
Reviews.Content: The room I stayed in with a friend was very small, however it served it purpose. This hotel is quaint and has a lot of history, but what really counts is the location. Right in the heart of Gaslamp, we were able to walk everywhere we needed to get to. The restaurant next door/through the lobby was good, open 24 hours and has an extensive menu. Definitely not the lap of luxury, but will suite just fine if what you want is a place to crash. We didn't really hear any outside noise, and were on the first floor facing the back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but average service”
Reviews.Author: Niels N
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in this hotel on a saturday. The hotel looks great and authentic, also read the sign in the elevator, it explains why they're so slow. The 1p queensize rooms are not too big. Small bathroom without a tub. At Saturday night, the noise from the street can be heard in the rooms adjacent to the street, so if you plan to sleep early, make sure you have a room on the other side. The service was average: I tried to book a hotel shuttle at 8am for pickup around noon and they were fully booked. All I could get was a 10am shuttle. Also, they will not stop at rental car stations, which are on the way there. All in all: great looking hotel, decent rooms, but average 'complimentary' services.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss the roof terrace!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah B
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel twice now and think it's great. The location is slap bang in the middle of the Gaslamp with all its restaurants and bars. Also, the roof terrace (you can take your drinks up there or sunbathe) has lovely views. If there's a game on you can look right into Petco Park! The staff were very good when I left my phone there after my first stay. Liked: location, roof terrace. Didn't like: valet parking is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Not the cleanest”
Reviews.Author: Comeonflywithme
Reviews.Content: I have to start by saying that the staff were incredibly kind and helpful but our room was outdated and not very clean. We had a 2 room suite that was anything but sweet. Aside from being dirty, the tub didn't drain and we were stuck taking showers with dirty water up to our ankles. I don't think we will be back anytime soon

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: oswel
Reviews.Content: I first looked at this property when it was being converted from offices to timeshare units in the 1990s. I was tempted to buy into it then because of its location in the heart of downtown San Diego, right near the active Gaslamp Quarter entertainment district, but decided against it. However, in 2011 when I had business in San Diego, I figured I'd try it out as a hotel. I wasn't disappointed. My first impression upon entering the hotel was somewhat of a put-off, as the lobby desk is a bit shabby, and the staff seems a little amateurish. However, the rooms themselves are nice and the staff turned out to be very personable and quite helpful. The rooms are small (I've stayed in two of them, so far), but they're decorated in the boutique hotel style. Though I was happy to be in the heart of the city and within a few blocks of restaurants and Horton Plaza (the downtown shopping mall), the loud music from adjacent bars had me concerned. Happily, the noise quieted right down at 10:00 PM, allowing me to wake refreshed for a meeting the next morning. A complimentary breakfast is offered on the rooftop deck, but since I'm a low-carb guy, there wasn't much for me to choose. Still, it's nice to have the option. I got my room during each stay for just under $100 a night before tax. For that price, it's hard to beat without going out to more suburban locations. I didn't have a car but took the MTS city bus from the airport directly downtown (one block from the hotel). However, the hotel does offer valet parking for a fee.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but good location!”
Reviews.Author: New-Flying-Dutchman
Reviews.Content: In the heart of the gaslampdistrict, the Ramada Inn & Suites is well located for tourists. Restaurants en shops are within walking distance, which is very convenient during the evening. The rooms are small (compact) but have all essentials. We used the valet-parking offered by the hotel for a reasonable fee. An excellent service when you decided to go to San Diego by car. The Convention Center is also within walking distance, making this hotel interesting for tourism and business.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: redwhiskeypete
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a great location. I read some of the negative reviews and I didn’t experience any of the problems in those reviews. I believe we stayed in room 518. I requested two beds. What we got was two separate bedrooms each with their own tv, it was NOT small. Yes the hotel was old but had character and was very clean. If I would have stayed longer I would have liked to spent some time on the roof patio with a book. I plan on staying there again next time I’m in San Diego and have recommended this hotel to a couple I know that is traveling to San Diego in March. The price is right also, I don't think you could find anywhere else to stay for the price and the quality of this hotel if your staying in the Gas Lamp district. I also found all the staff to be helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint place with a few issues”
Reviews.Author: rgtsc01
Reviews.Content: The Ramada Gaslamp was built in 1913 and it is a quaint place, a hotel from a long-ago time. For one, the elevators are the original ones, and will celebrate their 100th birthday next year. To enter them, you have to open a door, as if entering a room. Then, there is a an accordian-style gate that must be pushed back. When pulling a wheeled suitcase, getting in these elevators requires some dexterity. Other than that, they work fine. Rooms are small, and mostly complete. My standard room had a coffee maker but no fridge. There is a desk with task lamp, an open closet to hang clothes and a slightly cramped bathroom. First night I was in my room, I took a shower, no problem. For some reason, the next day, the cold water shower tap didn't work. Only the hot side worked. Room was a tad warm, even in San Diego winter. There is a small air conditioning unit in the window that I used at night. The bed was very comfortable. I was able to hear a woman in an adjacent room, who souded like she had COPD. Walls are a tad thin. Also internet access in my 2nd floor room was very weak. Desk staff of the hotel were very friendly and knowledgable. There is a 24-hour restaurant named Brians 24 next door. This was very good (and handy) although the portions were definitly super-sized. Brians 24 has internet access and serve breakfast all day, if you like that. This was an okay place to stay. Despite it's age, it still is a basic, functional hotel and convenient to both the Gaslamp and Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place, great location”
Reviews.Author: PaulTheTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: Great location makes up for small rooms. Hey, this is an old hotel, built when we didn't demand huge rooms and massive bathrooms. It served my purpose well, and it's location near restaurants and bars was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: UTdavid
Reviews.Content: I checked reviews on this hotel before I booked it. There were good and bad reviews but I thought the good out weighd bad, so I booked it. Most of the bad reviews were about size of room, the elevator and some about it not being clean and the shuttle taking to long to pick up at the airport. I did not have a problem with any of these. I called for the shuttle when I arrived at the airport and it took about 15 min. When I arrived at the hotel I was expecting it to be slightly ragged or worn but it looked really nice all decorated for the hollidays. I was expecting a closet for a room bit it was fine. The staff was wonderfull. They were all very helpful and friendly. They greeted me every time I walked through the lobby and answered any questions that I had. Adam was the desk clerk on duty the 2 days I stayed and he was great. Do not listen to the bad reviews concerning this hotel because it was great and if I go to San diego i will stay there again. Thanks for the good time.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff saved this trip”
Reviews.Author: YUM1111
Reviews.Content: This hotel features what was once the fastest elevator in the world--in 1907! It's really cute. Other reviewers cry about the tight quarters, but let's face it: downtown hotels are not really roomy at $75/night. The problem is the paper thin walls. We could hear the people next door whenever they spoke--especially when they were by the bathroom, which butted up against the room. I'm afraid to think about what the people next door heard from us! ;-) It was basically an average to below average hotel. Saving grace: the front desk and valet staff (especially the valets). They were super helpful and eager to help us. I'm betting they liked this place better before it became a Ratmada.... Still, a great trip thanks to their helpfulness, a comfortable bed, and an amazing location. If you're only using your room to wrap yourself around the love of your life, this place is fine for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Tidy room with a great deck on the roof and lots of style.”
Reviews.Author: Gregory H
Reviews.Content: Blast from the past rooms, but comfy and clean. Small but architecturally interesting rooms. Great staff and a super view from the top of the hotel where there is an open 360 degree vista of San Diego. Neat hotel for its age. In the heart of the Gaslamp area in San Diego. Parking is tough on the street. Short walk to Petco and the Convention Center. Historic property.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Hostle”
Reviews.Author: Mitchie69
Reviews.Content: If you have no choice in hotel, squint your eyes, and stay out of your room as much as you can, this hotel will be just OK. The room was very small, spartan, and just had the feeling of not clean. They give you a rack on the wall to hang cloths, because the closet is the bathroom. The mini sink is a joke, and when you bend down to rinse your mouth, your back side hits the wall or pokes into the stall they call a shower. You can not get out of the shower stream, note no tub, even when the temp does it's random changes from ice to steam. I could not soap below the waist without getting out of the shower. The bed was a bit short, which it needed to be, because all that was left in the room was a walkway around the bed. The elevators are very quaint and historic. Which means small. They also require two hands to deal with the spring loaded doors. Lots of fun with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “A nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Maristela A
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old, dirty, and people are not friendly, exceptly for two girls that work during the day in the front desk. There are lots of loud parties in the night that will make you wish to go back anywhere besides the hotel. It does not matter if you are tired or not. You will not sleep or rest. Do not eat at the restaurant aside because they are so confused that they charged you wrong bills to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Ramada Relic”
Reviews.Author: cyclingsanchez
Reviews.Content: My room was a bargain; I know why this place needs a face lift and renovations - the room was so small there was no room for a closet or an ironing board (under the bed). My bathroom was so small it felt like being on a cruise ship. I literally had no room for my cosmetics bag in the sink area; no worries it found a nice home on the toilet close by. The shower was an exhilarating experience - ranging from hot and then cold - never knew what would come out so I stood out of the way and ventured in when the time was right. Of course shaving my legs was out of the guestion because of the small size. The location is good right next to the gas lamp touristy area; but bring your ear plugs because it is loud outside. I was asked for money twice on my great adventure to find dinner. The ancient slow elevators were a hassle with luggage and having to hold the gates and doors open.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Cricca72
Reviews.Content: The premises are quite old and need a renovation but the location is great. Bars, restaurants, public transportation and some points of interest are just round the corner. It gets a bit noisy a night, so if your sleep can be disturbs easily this is not the right hotel... Since we do not have this problem we enjoined our staying.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: PurdueBetsy
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel, built way before we started demanding huge rooms and suites. I stayed here as an alternative to the more expensive conference hotels located nearer the convention center. It was a 10-15 minute walk in the morning, about 10 blocks. I stayed Sun – Thurs, so I didn’t have the raucous noise that might accompany Friday or Saturday nights in the Gaslamp district. The room is very small, so don’t plan to spend much time there. They do have free wireless and a tiny desk, but I wouldn’t consider this a good place to work. The room was fairly clean, the bed was small (really only suitable for one adult), but comfortable. The bathroom is very cramped, with no place to put your toiletries. My room was a shower-only and the showerhead is too low for a normal-sized person. I’m 5’10” and I had do a deep knee bend and contortions to wash my hair. The historic elevator, while quaint, is nearly impossible to navigate with a roller bag and a shoulder bag. There’s a door that opens outward and then a heavy gate you have to slide open to enter/exit the elevator. It’s kinda tricky. I can't imagine someone who is weak or infirm trying to open the gate. The front desk staff was friendly enough. All in all, if I had to do it over again, I’d probably stay in a more expensive, closer hotel, but the Ramada was satisfactory in terms of value.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff.....Great location”
Reviews.Author: Allan G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in the gaslamp district. We spent alot of time on the rooftop having a few cocktails and just enjoying the view. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Lots of excellent bars and restuarants in the immediate area. Every morning (at about 0630) I took a walk down to the bay and always felt safe. The only negative I can possibly think of was the plumbing.....It's probably old and the shower went form hot to cold. Had to do a "shower dance" to get clean! As far as the elevators, we loved them, a great piece of history! We live in California and alot of our weekend trips are spent in San Francisco.......This will change. Some of our time will be spent in San Diego and in this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Abbymac4
Reviews.Content: Overall we found this hotel to be good. We stayed in a standard queen room.The area was safe with plenty of cafes and restaurants. We had no problems with itinerants or drug requests/offers as one previous reviewer did. We are 2 middle aged women and found the gaslamp area very convenient and safe. The rooms are small and older, but being in a historic hotel we expected this. The bed was more like a double than a queen but was comfortable and although the rooms were clean but they could have done with a little updating and refreshing. We had a front room but had no problems with noise at all. All of the staff, except for one quite arrogant young man, were pleasant and helpful. Free WiFi and airport shuttle were convenient to have. Yes the lifts are old, but not that inconvenient. I would stay here again as it was a good average hotel in a good location and good value for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in central location”
Reviews.Author: SueC43
Reviews.Content: We were initially concerned about the location as there are some very odd people that seem to hang around Gaslamp area but needn't have worried - great spot to wander to the many bars and restuarants and just people watch! It's very central and the staff were helpful and friendly. We had a car which they valet parked and were very efficient. No fridge in our Queen room but had tea/coffee facilities. Small bathroom but defintely adequate for our needs. Only negative is that our room seemed to be over the kitchen air extractor, and being 24hrs it was noisy most of the time. Hotel has a lot of character but the lifts were hard to operate if you had a suitcase in one hand - really needs someone to hold both doors open for you. View from the roof is great, and the breakfasts downstairs are huge. Has more of a 'relaxed' vibe rather than posh/corporate.

Reviews.Title: “Odd European-style 2-star hotel in questionable area”
Reviews.Author: Writer/Director
Reviews.Content: The first thing you'll notice are the ancient elevators. Or, elevator singular -- the second was closed for the first part of my trip. Apparently the fastest elevators in the USA when they were installed in 1920-1930 (can't remember when). They're the kind of elevator cage doors you have to manually open. Kind of cool, but impossible to deal with while carrying luggage. There really needs to be a porter on the main floor to help people who are checking in open the cage elevator door. And also a bottle of Purell on each floor. The cage and outer door were sticky with oils and whatnot from other guests hands. The rooms are incredibly tiny, and beds even tinier. I was traveling alone, so this was fine, but had I been sharing the bed it would've been incredibly uncomfortable. It could've been a queen bed, but looked more like a double. The bathroom isn't actually separated from the room. The sink is in the bedroom area, next to the bed and make-shift closet. There is a sliding door that covers the entrance to the toilet and shower, but it isn't any different than having a curtain. If you are traveling alone, as I was, no big deal. But if you are traveling with another person, you will hear every sound as if it were in the same room. Because it is essentially in the same room. Sheets were clean, and the A/C which was a haphazard window unit, worked fine. The service at the front desk, complimentary airport shuttle, housekeeping... all were totally fine. The Gaslamp area is a questionable location. It could be perfect for you if you are a college student looking to party until the wee hours of the morning (as there are endless night clubs and bars and large crowds of other drunk or stoned people every 20 feet for about an eight-block radius) when you'll be able to drunkenly stagger into the hotel's lobby cafe for food at 4 AM (it's open 24 hrs and was PACKED at 4 AM with both late-night party-types; and also people who worked in nearby clubs and bars who had just gotten off work). One night I was standing outside of the hotel having a cigarette and was asked by a person just walking by at random, if I "wanted any heroin?" I simply said, No, thanks, and they asked, "Crack?" No, I said, I'm fine. "Coke? Weed?" Really, I said, I'm fine, thank you. They finally left me alone and walked on. Another night walking back from a restaurant, I was at the corner of the hotel outside the 24 hr cafe, and a young college kid, obviously drunk, asked me if I had any cocaine. In all my travels in a variety of places of the world I've never been asked to buy drugs or if I had them to share. This is why I'd consider the Gaslamp area questionable. I mean, if you like that kind of thing, great! Good for you. You'd have a ball staying at this hotel, as it's right in the center of it all. But if you are looking for something safer, or if you are traveling with kids, my advice is to stay anywhere but the Gaslamp area. I visited the restaurants in the Hillcrest area, which seemed much safer and calmer. Nicer. I didn't get to see any of the hotels by the beach, or in any other area. If I ever return to San Diego, I'll be staying in one of those.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Jean W
Reviews.Content: My husband, 18 year-old daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights in the middle of August. Our room was great - very comfortable. We had two queen beds in two adjoining rooms. Our daughter's room had its own sink and TV, we had a large bathroom and TV. The room was across from the elevator but it was noisy only a couple of times. Pillows were not the greatest however. We were on the 9th floor so we did not have the noise problem from the nightclub next door as long as we had our air conditioners on like some people have experienced. Staff was great, very friendly and accomodating. Valet parking for $20 a night, the guys got the car very quickly. Hotel was a originally the Hotel St. James that has been renovated, but it still has the original, quaint elevator from 1913. Rooftop terrace was very nice. The location was great - we could walk to Petco Park, and there were many restaurants to choose from in the area. Also close driving to zoo, Sea World, Coronado, etc. Overall the hotel was very nice for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Historic, Charming, and Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: smithal12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights during a tennis tournament. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was comfortable and clean. My only complaint would be the room and bathroom were a little small. Unique to the hotel are the twin elevators from 1913 and the amazing 360 rooftop view of San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great customer services, great neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: morten505
Reviews.Content: Beautiful historic hotel located in the Gaslamp district. Staff friendly and attentive to customer needs. Charming historic elevator, but a little slow. Small room but well equipped with all necessary services. Comfortable bed. Neighborhood a bit nosy at night, but the air conditioning covers it. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great, historical hotel in a great neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: pointandshoot
Reviews.Content: Pros: - charming old school historical hotel. Check out the lifts! - centrally located in the gas lamp district where most of e tourist attractions are (within walking distance). The San Diego zoo is just 5 - 10 mins away by car (not walkable). - the restaurant (brians 24) is great. Check out their weekday mega breakfasts man. Otherwise, head a few blocks down to Richard walkers pancake house Cons: - parking's super expensive: 20 bucks for valet. Street Parkin is difficult to find and expensive as well. There are various private garages around e hotel that offer differing rates but it all works out to be more costly than e hotel valet. Overall: would definitely stay again. We have no complaints about this hotel. Staff were all very friendly and helpful too, which is more than I can say for a lot of hotels with a similar star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: HeatherBacon
Reviews.Content: Let me first start by saying that my husband and I are not pretentious not do we frequently stay at posh hotels, so that is not at all what we were expecting when booking this hotel. We booked our room after seeing the price, location and the pictures that are posted on their website. Boy were those pictures misleading! I found that most of the employees there were very nice, but I don’t feel that their friendly attitudes could make up for the condition of our hotel room. Our room was like a closet and very dirty. I felt obligated to wear flip flops while taking a shower as to not stand bare foot in the bathroom. I was completely stunned that a hotel room that cost as much as it did was in such bad shape. The walls were paper thin and we could hear normal voices talking next door to us, but they sounded as if they were in the same room with us. We were awakened very early in the morning by the sounds of other guests and the fire alarm going off for about 30 minutes. After falling back to sleep it happened again. We did not feel rested at all while we were there. Another BIG problem with our room was the lack of windows and lighting. The 2 windows in our room led to pitch black alley ways and we never had any natural lighting to get us ready to go in the morning. This was a very important trip for us and I feel that staying at this hotel seriously ruined it. I am very disappointed and hope that others will think about what they want in a good hotel and not just the price of it. Thanks Ramada Gaslamp for making my trip ans bad as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid room 926 like the plague”
Reviews.Author: MissTMA
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Ramada Gaslight hotel (formerly known as the St James Hotel) for five nights at the not too cheap rate of up to $180 a night. I was put in room 926 (on the 9th floor) which had a constant and irritatingly loud generator noise day and night. Having travelled to San Diego from South Africa, I was exhausted, and the constantly loud generator noise heard from this room (even from the bathroom) preventing me for getting a decent night's sleep for the full time I stayed at the hotel. I did complain to management midway during my stay, but given I was attending a conference day and night for the full duration of my stay, I could not take them up on their offer to change rooms, but notice they were not inclined to reduce my bill (even though they agreed the noise was a hindrance!). I was very annoyed they put me in the noisy room in the first place, it was worse than Chinese Torture!!! So, bottom line, avoid room 926, and if you can, avoid this hotel, everything about it is old and run down, including the antiquated lifts.

Reviews.Title: “Manager needs to be retrained”
Reviews.Author: Long28
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms for me and my coworker to stay in San Diego for 2 days (June 22 and 23, 2011) on business. The rooms were prepaid in full and in advance. Both rooms were reserved under my name. My coworker checked in as scheduled on my behalf and stayed at this hotel for 2 days. My flight was canceled and I checked in one day later. When I checked in on June 23 in the afternoon, the manager on duty told me that he did not have a room for me and he sent me to the Days Inn. He asked me to pay the Days Inn with my own money. I reminded the manager that I paid for my room in full and in advance and it was already checked in on my behalf by my coworker the day before. He told me that there was nothing he could do because I did not show up the day before as scheduled. The manager refused to refund my prepaid money. I called Ramada's Customer Service at 800-828-6644 to open a case, the person on the phone told me that somebody will be in touch with me in 30 days. I called my credit card company to dispute the payment to this hotel. I hope my credit card company will refuse payment to Ramada as I requested. I hope the readers of my review will find a better experience in San Diego than I did.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't check Tripadvisor before I booked....big mistake!”
Reviews.Author: Silverponygirl
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotel stays I've ever had. I realize the place is old and historic so I wasn't expecting anything posh, but everything was just awful. The place was so noisy, I couldn't sleep. There was horrible hip-hop music coming from the room next to us and the walls were paper thin. All night long, I heard music, loud yelling, and car alarms going off. The bathrooms are tiny which weren't really a problem considering the age of the hotel but they weren't very clean. There were cracks in the tiles and gross mold everywhere. Just because a hotel is old doesn't give it the excuse of being dirty. Mold can be poisonous if inhaled; the hotel should spring for repairs when it comes to the health of its guests. I complained but the aloof staff just stared at me and did nothing. And ...I just HATE how their argumentative hotel manager gets online here on Tripadvisor and responds to every damn review written. People posting here don't want to read excuses for their complaints; bottom line was their experiences were bad and they had the right to express them. To the hotel management: Trust me...not one of your overly detailed, point-by-point responses will earn you a return customer and believe me, we do warn others not to stay at an awful establishment. Improve your hotel and your reviews will be better.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: bigtedshred
Reviews.Content: Hotel: This is a great location if you want to be the middle of all the action of the gaslamp. They offer free internet and a free airport shuttle! They also have 2 pc's with printers available all night. We didn't get up to the roof unfortunately. Elevator is super slow but it's the original which is cool. One time we walked down the 7 flights since it was taking so long. Check in / check out were simple. Staff were all super friendly. Room: The hotel is old and the rooms are small. We had a queen bed, and there was just enough room on both sides. There's a small AC unit in the window and since it is not the width of the window, the plastic accordion style shade (whatever that part is called) takes up the rest of the window. Sounds travel really easily though this. They actually make you sign an agreement saying you know it can be noisy in the gaslamp. For our Friday night we didn't notice, but we also spent the evening and night enjoying the gas lamp! Brand new LCD TV (they were installing them the weekend we were there). Bathroom needed an upgrade; everything in it was old and painted over. That was a downer. The rooms had big bottles of water for $1.50 each; such a deal!! If you're staying in the gaslamp to enjoy all the nightlife it has; I would definitely check out the Ramada Inn.

Reviews.Title: “You can't overlook this place!”
Reviews.Author: Wannabe_Traveler_WI
Reviews.Content: Where to start?! This hotel was perfect for the conference that is right down the street. The location is perfect because it's right in the middle of all the hustle and bustle. It seems that everything is just a stone's throw away with the conference center being easily within walking distance and a lot of places to eat at all in the same area. The Blue Line trolley stop is just a couple of blocks away if you wanted to explore the rest of the city. Another great feature of the building is that it stands out being red and having a "Hotel St. James" sign lit up on top, making it easy to find in all states of sobriety or lack thereof. The lobby looks luxurious with two chandeliers hanging down and a very nice staff at the desk greeting you as you go in and head out for the day. They are also very knowledgeable on the city and will do anything for you. I called in last night actually because we ran out of toilet paper on the sixth floor and in less than 3 minutes, one of the men (I assume the door man) rushed it up to our room. Very impressive. The room we are in is two seperate rooms, which works great if you have two genders staying with each other that aren't in a relationship with each other, although there is only one bathroom that is in one of the rooms, but the bug plus is that each room has its own sink and TV with a door that can seperate the two rooms! You can also enter whatever room you would like from the hallway, which means you don't have to disturb the person sleeping in the other room when you come in after a night out! I would definitely come stay here again and would recommend it to anyone visiting San Diego. The only drawbacks from our rooms are that the view from the windows gives us no view of the city, but you can get up on the roof and look at the whole city and admire it! The other negative is that you can't save money on food by buying from a grocery and keeping it in a refrigerator because our room doesn't have one and I'm not sure if other rooms have one either. But remember...you're in San Diego! Go out and live a little! Time to go out this morning and check the view on the roof from this 10-story building! COLLEGE STUDENTS- Don't get a hostel! I've seen my friends there and I really suggest spending the extra money and getting a room here. They're regretting it every morning!

Reviews.Title: “Review of Ramada Gaslamp [San Diego Convention Center]”
Reviews.Author: wbrantle
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, located in the entertainment district of San Diego. My room was very clean with attentive housekeeping staff, the food was excellent, and the staff was most helpful. Because of the location, there was some street noise, which was substantial on St. Patrick's Day. The noise presented no problem for me. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others visiting the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Altius007
Reviews.Content: A nice enough hotel for the price. Old world charm. Basic rooms. No safe in room. Staff all very friendly and a great location. Walking distance to the conference centre. Great rooftop area. The only downside is the noise from the adjacent night clubs. Even on Sunday night I had to listen to hardcore hip hop way past midnight. Annoying!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Tireless_Rider
Reviews.Content: The good: - Free airport shuttle picked up us in just ten minutes, we asked for the free shuttle in a counter in the airport. They called the hotel for us and asked for it. - Lovely elevators! (although the heavy doors, uncomfortable if you are carrying some luggage) - Gentile employees. The bad: - On friday night, there was too much noise from the street due to a nightclub near the hotel. - Small (but comfortable) room. - During daytime, downtown is deserted. - Expensive parking.

Reviews.Title: “The Gas-Lamp Ramada/St. James Hotel in San Diego, CA Gets a Thumbs UP From Me”
Reviews.Author: Gorgo711
Reviews.Content: My stay was 02/11/2011 - 02/12/2011. Like most customers in today's world I first read all the reviews for the hotels in the area of the Gas-Lamp district of San Diego before booking my stay. I had seen some negative reviews written about the Ramada and know that every business in the world has some bad reviews. Well I can tell you this, don't believe everything you read. I did my research about the area and the hotel Ramada/St. James and seen that it was in the middle of the most happening part of the Gas-Lamp district and that it was a historical landmark built in 1885 by Dr. P. C. Remondino. Read the awesome history of this hotel, copy and paste this link: http://www.sandiegohistory.org/journal/56april/james.htm Now for my review, I arrived at San Diego airport 10:30 am picked up my luggage at the baggage claim and called the hotel's front desk, 10 minutes later the hotel shuttle has curbside to pick me up and bring me back to the hotel, the drive was very courteous and informative to all my question about the city. Once at the hotel I was greeted by the front desk like I was a VIP. Check-in was a breeze and again I ask a million more questions about the city since it was my first time in San Diego and they informed me of all the great things in and around San Diego. Now besides the elegant lobby was the much talked about elevators that some customers complained about, but I'm sure they never read the history of them. The two polished brass doors, the fastest most state of the art elevators in the time. People traveled from all over to ride them. They worked fine for my entire stay without a glitch, and they are around 100 years old! So after the ride up to the 6th floor I arrived at my room, the room was very clean, the view was great, and yes they have WIFI and Cable TV. The maid service was also great, after each days meeting when I returned to the room it was clean and everything was in order. No room complaints here. Now talk about the best view, if you go up to the 10th floor you can access the rooftop that has seating, tables and endless views 360 degrees and great sunset. Trust me I have an album of around 100 pictures taken from the roof. The noise in the area at night was normal for any center city location so the complainers must have never stayed in a city before. The restaurant/bar connected to the hotel is Brian's 24 and let me tell you the prices and food were great, I enjoyed each meal and I had breakfast, Lunch, Dinner at Brian's 24 and they also handle the room service for the Ramada which was great even at 3am.

Reviews.Title: “LOUD !! One of the worst hotel stays of my life !”
Reviews.Author: Smittysez
Reviews.Content: Pros: Very clean. There is a very nice roof top patio with a 270 degree view of San Diego Bay and much of downtown. Location is 6th and F streets, at the edge of the Gaslamp district. Free Wifi, and 2 guest computers on the 1st floor. There's a 24-hour restaurant adjacent to the hotel providing dining and room service (looked OK, we did not try it). The historic 11 story building is from the turn of the 20th century. The elevators were installed in 1913, slow but a charming, functioning antiquity. Cons: ** VERY LOUD *** !! The hotel is adjacent to a rowdy night club. We heard yelling, screaming, fighting and motorcycles all night. It was impossible to sleep until after 3:00am, even with ear plugs. Within 50 feet of the hotel entrance there were homeless people sleeping in the doorways, prostitutes, drunks and vomit on the side walk. The room was very small, I could not walk around the bed with the suitcase next to it. The Ramada website sold me a queen bed. This is an outright lie. There are no queen beds in the hotel. These are 54" standard double beds, but the hotel staff insists they are queen. This is not a hotel for mature adults. The average age here was about 25, many military, all of them there to party. The screams of passion came form every other door as I walked down the hall at night. But, we saw no problems with the behavior of any of the young guests in the public areas the hotel. Maintenance was lacking. The bed ruffle had large brown stains along one side. There were scratches and gouges in the wall and woodwork everywhere. The service was poor. Outside the elevator, dishes from a guest's breakfast remained from my check-in at 3:00pm until I went to bed at 1:00 am. Parking is $20 per night, valet only. Bellman was slow and inefficient. Front desk staff was efficient and polite, but aloof and uncaring. No pool or hot tub. NOT for families!! Summary: If you are under 30 and looking to party all night in the Gaslamp, great location. Anyone else, STAY AWAY !! Scale of 1 to 5: Location=5 Staff=2 Cleanliness=4 Maintenance=2 Room-comfort=2 Bed-comfort=3 Romantic-getaway=1 Family=1 Quiet=1 Value=1

Reviews.Title: “Great little historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: JTF25
Reviews.Content: Great service, including friendly smiles and greetings, and very very clean. Quiet location in the Gas Lamp, close to entertainment along 5th Avenue, and close to Convention Center and Ballpark. The elevators are the manual swing door type, built in 1913, but they work quite well. Stairs are a nice option - open stairwells, nice carpet runners, and well lit.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with real character”
Reviews.Author: spidersardej5
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect place to stay if you don't need all the "extras", but appreciate cleanliness and good service. Our room was rather small, and we did not have a frig (no room for it, really), but it did have an iron and a coffeemaker. This was an independently-run hotel before the Ramada bought it, so it has lots of charm. The location is perfect (we could walk to everything) and it's a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: 5scheidemona
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely place. The staff is helpful and professional, the rooms are clean and warm (though a bit on the smallish side but, then again, this place is 100 yrs old!), the rooftop deck has amazing views, the vintage elevator adds to the ambience, and the 24 hr restaurant attached is excellent. We'll definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Gem in San Diego Gas Lamp District”
Reviews.Author: ronbauer
Reviews.Content: First time staying here. Great location and a gem! The staff are friendly, helpful and dedicated to their guests. Couldn't be happier!

Reviews.Title: “Every time I returned it felt like I was being welcomed home.”
Reviews.Author: deb60898
Reviews.Content: Wonderful double that made traveling with an adult son so much easier that normal rooms. We each had our own bedroom. Quaint with lots of old world details like tall ceilings and crown molding. Wonderful view from roof top patio. Close to everything and felt safe walking anywhere around hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for a San Diego Gaslamp District experience”
Reviews.Author: tj1
Reviews.Content: Thank you Ramada Downtown San Diego. Enjoyed a special night in the Gaslamp District. with your fine hospitality. Reception friendly & helpful. Room comfortable, hotel historic and beds fluffy & a good sleep. Easy access to Horton Plaza Shopping Center. Gaslamp District shops, clubs and restaurant all in walking distance. Used Trolley from downtown SD to Mission Valley and watched the San Diego State Aztecs Football game too. Parking is a bit expensive at $20 in and out privileges, but easy to find on street free parking nearby. Free wireless i-net, good connection, Free Sunday newspaper, even on weekends - thank you! The historic St James Hotel is now Ramada Gaslamp. We recommend it to all to enjoy. tj

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for your buck-Grt location, staff, and stay”
Reviews.Author: Hotelguy6
Reviews.Content: Staff is very friendly, helpful but non-obtrusive. Best location in town, walking distance to everything. They volunteer to hold your bags and watch your car after checkout if you want to enjoy the area. 24-hr restaurant is a hot spot, and room service is always available. I lived in the area and on return see why everyone always thanked me for recommending them to this hotel. I suggest going with a friend and getting the two adjoining rooms-best deal in town, even the motel 6 can't compete(i would never stay there though). If you want to stay somewhere where you dont want to lock yourself up in the hotel all day, stay here. Awesome view from the rooftop also. Quaint old-school elevator too.

Reviews.Title: “poor experience overall”
Reviews.Author: CourtneyMD
Reviews.Content: I was rather disappointed by my stay. I had to wait about 45 minutes for the free airport shuttle when I first arrived. Then when I got to the hotel around noon, after many hours of flights across the country, I was informed a room couldn't be made available for me since the cleaning crew was taking their lunch break. When I did check in, I was surprised to have to sign a waiver basically saying I would have no expectations for quiet at night since the hotel is located in the gaslamp district, and after spending a few nights in the room, I can see why they have you sign such a waiver to say the least. The hotel's elevators are very difficult to use as you must open a heavy door and slide back a rather heavy gate each time you want to get on or off...for this reason, I would not recommend this hotel for elderly folks, those traveling with children, or anyone who has some sort of physical disability that would make this difficult--and even for someone without limitations, this was a difficult process when carrying things, etc. I found the rooms to be relatively cramped. Oddly, each bedroom had its own sink with a shared bathroom which did not have a sink. Even on full tilt, the air conditioners could not keep the room cool. The hotel staff seemed very disorganized, for example, I was out of my room for most of a day and returned after 4 pm to find my room had not been cleaned...then a cleaning lady knocked on the door to see if I wanted it cleaned, then 10 minutes later someone called to see if I wanted it cleaned, with no explanation why it hadn't been cleaned at a more typical hour. I was excited about the rooftop garden, but when I went up there to check it out I found the bar tender sunning herself on the bar with gangsta rap blaring...perhaps this is not exactly a good hotel choice for business travelers. No free breakfast available at the hotel, and I did not find many good options for a cheap and quick breakfast in the area. The hotel seems to be located in a seedier section of the gaslamp district, whenever I left the hotel early in the morning or returned later in the evening I would walk by many homeless people sleeping in doorways or going through dumpsters along the street, if you are a woman traveling alone you might feel safer elsewhere. If all of the above won't bother you, you will find this hotel to be one of the better financial values of the area hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Charisma, Old World Charm, excellant location!”
Reviews.Author: JLBNottsUK
Reviews.Content: 6 of us stayed for 1 night prior to a cruise on 30th September, ages ranging from 33 to 80 years old. We all thoroughly enjoyed this hotel, coming from the UK, the room sizes were average to us, so no problem. The staff, especially Nina, were fantastic they were very helpful and polite. The hotel has an old world appeal including the historic lift - I am pleased that it has not been replaced by soleless modern one! The rooms were clean and still retain the original feel - it is good to stay in a hotel that belongs to the area it is located in, rather than modernises into a clone. The roof top garden is not to be missed, the view, at any time of day or night is superb. We were in 3 seperate rooms on 3 different floors and no one had a problem wih noise. "Brians" next door does excellant food 24 hours per day. We all would stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Historic, great location, tiny rooms.”
Reviews.Author: TooMuchJolt
Reviews.Content: We had a fun time in this little historic hotel. Elevator is the type with metal gate. Kids and I were a little scared at first. The rooms was TINY. But we got a GREAT deal so I couldn't complain. The bathroom tub does need updating. The hotel reminded me of a haunted older hotel. I Googled it, and it is NOT haunted...but that would have made the stay MORE interesting. Walking distance to Gas Lamp and the Horton Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a romantic weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: JDandFamily
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are in San Diego often and when we want to stay in the Gaslamp we stay at this Ramada. Its a unique building with an old fashioned elevator. The rooms are clean and cozy. Checkin is easy and we are always treated well. They have a great resteraunt accessible from the hotel. The location is perfect, youre right in the middle of it all. Overall great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “It was great & quiet for being in middle of downtown.”
Reviews.Author: finrizel
Reviews.Content: It was very nice and amazingly quiet for the area. I would definetly go again.

Reviews.Title: “A facade!”
Reviews.Author: casayoga
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ramada gaslamp for one sleepless night. Upon our arrival after check in we shlepped the luggage dolly ourselves to the quaint but difficult to manage lift. The staff literally stood around and watched. My husband was working put the parking specs. I had my two kids and multiple pieces of luggage to manage. The room was tiny outdated and filthy! I have stayed in small old hotels in Paris and this was nothing like that! This hotel needs to be seriously updated and the staff needs a course on costumer service. I hate to say this, but this hotel also had a roach issue. We saw just one and it was downstairs in the hallway....but it was one to many. I could go on..there is noise issues..oh and drunk young people eating take out on the floor of the lobby..we got out of there!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SherpaP
Reviews.Content: After staying in luxury at Treasure Island in Vegas, the room at Ramada Inn San Diego was a bit of a reality check, but then this is not a fair comparison. If you want a reasonably priced and comfortable hotel room in the Gaslamp district in San Diego then this is the one to go for. We did quite a bit of research before booking and were not disappointed. The hotel and rooms are a bit quirky but that just reflects the age and history of the hotel and add's to it's charm. The roof-top patio area is brilliant and well worth a wander up to the 10th floor - take your camera. Then you are in the perfect location in the district right next to the main strip on 5th Avenue with all the restaurants and bars. We also used the valet service for parking and this represents good value for the area. Good hotel, Great location, good value for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the Gaslamp District”
Reviews.Author: LovieDovie3274
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Ramada on our way across the border to Real del Mar, south of Tijuana. The location is great - just a block away from the Gaslamp District. It's an older hotel so the rooms are a bit smaller than what we were expecting. The restaurant right there at the hotel is open 24/7 and it was always packed. I was told it's a favorite with the locals. The best part of this hotel, though, is the roof-top terrace. You get a 360 degree view of San Diego including Petco Park, Mission Bay, the Coronado Bay Bridge. We had cocktails up there one night and coffee and biscotti the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice time”
Reviews.Author: summer7708
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely hotel that had a very historical look about it. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. Small rooms but our teen daughters loved it since they had a separate room that was attached to ours. The Malls, Petco Park and Restaurants were very close and in walking distant. The best part of the hotel is the roof top with tables, chairs and you can view the whole city... AMAZING View! The staff was friendly & Valet quick. Parking was only $20.00 a night .. Great price since most hotels range from $35-40 a night. The house keeper forgot to clean our room but sometimes those things happen.:) ( no we did not have the DND sign out) We did get fresh towels etc - The only aggravating thing was the Elevator with the gate. A pain to get your luggage up and into because you have to hold the gate to get in. (If your double jointed or a contortionist it works out well) I just used the kids to hold it open... they worked well too! This hotel would be great for couples & singles but not the elderly. I personally will stay there again. I really liked it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality and advice”
Reviews.Author: hazel8i8
Reviews.Content: The hotel was 10 min walk to the convention center and the staff are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooftop Views”
Reviews.Author: KenCT
Reviews.Content: Like many other posters, I was charmed by this hotel despite my tiny, dark room. The views from the rooftop are beautiful. Every member of the staff seemed to be genuinely pleased to have my business, something that is not always the case. I appreciated availability of the free guest computers, and traveling without a car, I was happy to be withing a couple of blocks of major bus lines and the Trolley. I look forward to staying at the Ramada Gaslamp again.

Reviews.Title: “"Nice" but not for business.”
Reviews.Author: tinster9
Reviews.Content: Rooms are as described by everyone else. Historic and interesting. My encounters with the front desk staff were great. However, if you are here on business and need a stable wifi connection do not stay here. Assuming you can connect, the last speed test was 189 kbps. Each night there was a gathering of folks trying to get a decent internet connection on the roof. Everyone was frustrated as heck.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location- Terrible manager, incompetent staff-DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Azcs2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night at this property and loved the location. Yes, the room was small but it had a ceiling fan and that was nice. Yes, the elevators were horribly slow- there are only two and one was out of commission. On a historical note, they are the original elevators from like 1916, so they were small and slow and you could see the floors go by- charming, if you like that sort of thing- still - a "quaint" touch. Walking up the stairs to our room was like a maze, the stairs didn't go straight up or even serpentine but had to wander around to find the next set- just another "charming" detail for this older hotel. All of this I understand and appreciate, it is an old hotel after all. My husband and I paid cash for the room and gave the clerk a cash deposit of $100.00 with a receipt that said - DEPOSIT. When I went to check out, apparently the clerk did something wrong and did not note we paid the room fee plus the deposit fee. The manager WOULD NOT REFUND OUR $100.00. He refused to call the clerk who was off that day and ask her if we gave her two $100.00 bills. He all but called us liars when we were very specific on the cash we gave the clerk just the previous afternoon and he REFUSED to apologize or even admit that his staff was at fault preferring to let us make a scene at the counter where people were coming in to check-in. His attitude was not one of customer service. His only offer was that the next day when the controller came in, he would check the deposit or something and then mail us a check for the $100.00. San Diego was the start of our vacation and we had been saving up for it for awhile. His inablity to resolve the situation to the customer's satisfaction, caused us to cancel our plans for that day.

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Place!”
Reviews.Author: malycat
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip back to this hotel and once again I was delighted! Located directly in the downtown gaslamp district in San Diego I was able to walk to tons of restaurants, bars and shopping. If you are without a car this is the only place you want to be (I had a car too). A quaint historic hotel always puts me in a mind set of “how it was” yet still offers everything any hotel offers including a fantastic 24 hour restaurant and pub. I had a super view from my room of the city and the harbor. Great staff, great bed, great service, great location, what more could one ask?

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Clean but dated/"charming" facility.”
Reviews.Author: Wongz
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a business trip and admittedly did not spend too much time in the hotel. However, while my room on the fifth floor was small, without closets and had older fixtures (as mentioned in other reviews), I came expecting these--given that the facility is a historic hotel. More importantly, the room was clean, the floor was quiet and staff very friendly. The location is very good for access to the ballpark, Gaslamp district and convention center. I'm not sure I would spend my family vacation here but for a quick or business trip, it was a good value and I would consider it again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: KristenRaeP
Reviews.Content: Whenver I go to San Diego, I stay at the Ramada Inn in the Gaslamp district. Everytime it is perfect and extremely accommodating- this time was no different. Their employees are perfection and they truly look out for their customers. Even though the rooms are stinking small because it's an older hotel, my promise is that you will not go wrong if you choose to stay at this marvelous spot.

Reviews.Title: “It's the place you REALLY want to like, but the staff prevents it.”
Reviews.Author: Redbull463
Reviews.Content: I went to San Diego for the Dodgers/Padres game and saw this hotel on Expedia. I was really just looking for a decent/cheap place to sleep after post-game partying. The hotel itself is in a really cool location, very centrally located in the Gas Lamp and walking distance from Petco Park. It's an old looking building that you can't miss (big-red-brick-building). We arrived at 3pm and were informed that our rooms were not clean yet, but they'd be ready in about 30-40 minutes. No biggy- we left and walked to a local outdoor shopping mall and hung out there for about an hour. Walked back and were told our room wouldn't be ready for another 40 minutes. Come on! After a brief complaint, our room magically became ready. The rooms are old and small (exposed pipes, radiant heater, old tile bathroom, etc.) but I wasn't expecting anything grand- it's a historic hotel! The elevators are the old style, you open the door and pull back a sliding gate- please keep your hands inside the elevator at all times. Be prepared to wait for an available elevator for awhile, since they are very slow (I can't remember if there is only one elevator or two). The rooftop lounge area is really cool and was the best part of the hotel. Great views and there are tables and lounge chairs if you want to hang out up there. There is a decent restaurant/bar downstairs, next to the lobby. It's open 24 hours and it gets pretty busy. I walked in there with a glass coke in my hand around 4pm- just to see if I could grab a to-go menu for after the game. The bartender promptly yelled at me for walking in with a glass in my hand. Sorry! We actually got food to-go from the restaurant around 1140pm. The place was packed and I saw a drunk guy throw up onto the floor by his table. Classy. Worst customer service part of the night- my friends and I got stuck in the lobby, between the lobby floor and I'm guessing the basement level for 20 minutes! It was really hot in that elevator- as there is no ventilation. When they were finally able to free us, the guy at the front desk didn't want anything to do with us. I was not asking for a free room- but at least give us something the for inconvenience- like a restaurant coupon, a free drink, no charge for their ridiculous parking fee- anything! Bottom line- had the service been a little better here- this would actually be a decent place to stay and I would return for future trips and baseball games. I will now spend the extra money and go stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: familytravel2and3
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business in the third week of April 2010. The room is small - queen bed, chair, dresser, TV, side table, sink, clothes rack and bag rack - but I wasn't cramped. I actually thought it was great for my needs. Bathroom has a toilet and shower. The room was very clean and stocked with plenty of towels and the usual toiletries. I loved the roof. One is invited to bring your own drink to the indoor/outdoor carpeted roof where there are tables and chairs. The 360 degree views of the city are absolutely incomparable. It was a serene, beautiful place for a nightcap. Front desk personnel were always friendly, engaging and eager to help with directions. The elevators are unique and original. Perhaps they are a little challenging. The hotel is only ten floors and I was on the fifth. Lazy me would take the elevator up to my room or the roof and then take the stairs down. The hallways are completed with a thick, luxurious carpet that are easy to walk on and absorbing of sound. I kept my window open at night because I enjoyed listening to the city in the evening. Free wireless in my room was appreciated. This hotel is easy walking distance to the convention center, Petco Park, Horton Plaza, bars and restaurants. I really enjoyed the Ramada as a business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: j_nine13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over Mardi Gras for one night. The parking was a major hassle because they already had roads blocked off for the festivities. Once we got to the hotel everyone was very nice and helpful. The hotel is very old so the rooms were VERY small and yes, we only had one bed in the room, but I don't think I've ever been in a smaller hotel room. It didn't bother me because we weren't there to spend time in the hotel room. Despite the smallness, it was clean and comfortable ~ which is important to me. It was convenient to all sorts of stuff and never having been to San Diego, I thought it was great because you could walk and see all sorts of stuff. My favorite part of the hotel though was their rooftop terrace. We got some champagne from Bacchus Wine Market & Tasting Room (a great little wine shop a few blocks from the hotel ~ no need to get the random stuff at the convenience store) and drank it while we watched the sunset. It was an awesome place to get great views of the city. The have a decent restaurant on site but it was just basic bar food. I suggest walking to something better as there is so much close by.

Reviews.Title: “Noir vibe, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: NatashaMaria
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 100 years old and you can tell. But that gives it a cool vibe. The room was tiny with no closet and windows that opened into a dark air shaft. But it grew on me. I liked the ceiling fan and the noir window blinds. The bed was a small queen, but it was new and comfortable. The pillows were tiny, but they give you four. The bathroom was tiny, with a standup shower stall, but very clean. Room service was fast and yummy. I arrived at noon but was told to come back at 3 for check-in. No biggie. It's a great neighborhood to walk around. Lots of restaurants and shops, and the convention center and waterfront are right down the street. Go to the little "smoothies and tortas" shop across the street. The smoothies are all natural and good. A husband and wife just opened it and she did all the paintings in the place herself. There are no smoking rooms, which was fine by me, but if you smoke, you might want to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A DUMP”
Reviews.Author: biotch
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the worst place ever..... the room was the size of a closet the TV didnt work, there was mold all over the bathroom floor, furnishing was in such bad taste, this place was a dump.....

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: cooperBozeman_Mt
Reviews.Content: Spend a little more for a decent bed. The bed was a very small "queen," and the sheets were the cheapest and very worn. Lumpy pillows. The bathroom was barely adequate, with a tiny sink. Difficult to turn on and off water. Very old hotel, and needs a complete overhaul. Location is okay if you're okay with the noise. It was loud until early a.m. hours--street music, yelling, sirens. There were homeless sleeping on the sidewalk less than a block away. Service was polite, but indifferent. Coffee in the restaurant was $3.50!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel review”
Reviews.Author: KathyR3
Reviews.Content: Hotel was convenient to downtown, clean and comfortable. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I absolutley Love St. James Ramada”
Reviews.Author: JulieMartin86
Reviews.Content: We're just up the freeway from Orange county and we visit San Diego about once every 4 months or so and make it a point to stay at the St James. We love it. Its a great piece of history (had the fastest elevators in the country in its heyday! ....not so much any more :)) but still a great experience. sure the elevators have crazy old doors and are slow and a bit scary (but perfectly safe). The rooms are a bit small but how much are you really going to be in there anyway? our favorite thing is to get a few drinks either from Brian's downstairs or bring our own and sit on the rooftop and enjoy the scenery. Its a great location, the rooms are very clean and the staff are very friendly. a great price for a great piece of history and location. I would definitely recommend it if you're not a snob.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mockingjay
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights at the Ramada during Comic-Con International 2009 and was overall pretty happy with the hotel. it has a great location being the centre of the historic gaslamp quarter and a short walk to the San Diego convention centre and the horton plaza. I didn't have high expectations of the hotel from other reviews I had read but because of Comic-Con and the comparative lateness of my booking I didn't have a lot of other options. The hotel does have a certain amount of charm, but mostly it is just old. The sliding metal doors on the lifts are inconvenient most of the time, and incredibly difficult with luggage. My room was a simple and small and basically conisted of a bed, desk, TV and bathroom. As it was just me this wasn't an issue although it would be extremly cramped with another person. The bathroom is quite small and old but was clean. The free in- room wifi was amazing and is what actually made me decide to book there over somewhere else. Generally it was quiet although it got loud occasionally at night as there are some pubs and clubs nearby. I checked out other booking websites (and the Ramada itself) but the cheapest rate available was with wotif.com which seems to have an all year round rate. That actually made it cheaper than most places in San Diego in July. The staff were always friendly and helpful but I will probably book somewhere cheaper and less central next time I'm in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother with this place”
Reviews.Author: lee11758
Reviews.Content: Oh my God, what a hotel. It is ancient in every possible way, the service, the rooms, the elevator, the decor everything. We were recommended this hotel by a relative who lived in San Diego looking through the internet for a good location at a reasonable price. She suggested this hotel so I booked and unfortunately paid for two nights in advance thinking that she was recommending on experience not the internet. When we arrived I couldn't believe it.....the elevator with it's two ancient doors and the speed, a snail could climb stairs faster and don't try to fit two people and luggage in it a one time, Then there was the smell, a musty old dispicable smell. Next there was the room, I thought we were in a cupboard. We left our luggage in the room , went straight up to the rooftop with the fake grass and skinny revolting access and saw the Hilton logo on the bay and went straight there. It was brand new opened about nine months ago and the price was only about $40 more than this crappy place - we couldn't leave fast enough even though it seems we have lost our two nights prepaid accommodation fees it was worth it not to be there. As for location, this hotel is ok if you don't mind mingling with homeless people asleep in the closest alcove to the hotel on 6th Avenue even during the day. There are soooooo many better places to stay at in Downtown/Gaslamp area San Diego. Go anywhere but here

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in!!!”
Reviews.Author: sallylyn77
Reviews.Content: This truly was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. My boss booked this hotel because of it's location and reasonable price, but it wasn't worth it. I would have changed hotels after opening the door to my room, but I couldn't since I was with my boss. Negatives: Hotel is very old. Some people call that "charm", but I call it old, dirty, with no modern amenities. For example, the elevator is ancient, small and takes forever to come. Only one person with luggage will fit on it at a time. The entire hotel smells - old, dirty, and musty. My room was TINY. When you opened the door, there was literally less that 3 feet until you were already at the bed. The one sink was IN the room, not in the bathroom b/c it wouldn't fit. There was a TINY stand up shower with dirty shower curtain. The hotel is very noisy and they make you SIGN a WAIVER that they will not give a refund due to loud noise. That should have been a sign to turn and run! The furnishings in the room were old and there was only one nightstand. The linens looked ancient. The water would change temperature and scald you in a second. I have honestly stayed in nicer youth hostels than this hotel. I'm not sure who these people are who actually think it is acceptable. Like I said, if it had been up to me, I would have left upon arrival and just lost my money and gone somewhere else if i could have. POSITIVES: Free internet Great location Brian's 24 restaurant next door was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in the City”
Reviews.Author: Voiceover
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at several hotels in San Diego but this one is tops for many reasons. The Ramada Gaslamp (formerly the St. James Hotel) has a great location (forget the car - you won't need it), the hotel is brimming with charm and the staff are world-class. From the moment we stepped in the front door, we felt as though we were the only guests in the hotel. Immediate attention, all questions answered with pleasure and our needs attended. The rooms are clean and comfortable and priced right as well. Complimentary airport transportation was a life-saver. Great breakfast at Brian's next door. We spent several nights at this venue but with a week of travel in between - our trip began and ended in San Diego. Due to an unfortunate death in the family at home, our trip was cut short by two days. The kind folks at Ramada allowed us to easily change our itinerary without any penalty and allowed us to use the Presidential suite (at no additional charge) at a time when we could really use some extra comfort. When you're in San Diego and you're looking for value, location and comfort with a good dose of charm , look no more.

Reviews.Title: “I should have known...”
Reviews.Author: yainea
Reviews.Content: I should have know.. I should have known, I should have known. Just because they say it is a 3.5 star hotel, doesn't mean it really is a 3.5 star hotel, especially if you get it at $80 a night. And when Historic is in the title I should have definitely known better. No when you see the combination of historic and 3.5 stars, you think of an original building with modern/ classic decor. Not the fact that everything that you thought of as standard in any other hotel (and even motel) would be considered a godsend here. Elevator: I have to admit I thought the elevators were so cool because they were basically pre-historic. But when you had to wait 10 mins for it to come to you, you open the door and it is stuck between two floors, or when you are squished in there with 3 other people and two pieces of luggage, there's a problem (yep that right, in this elevator 3's a crowd). Ohh did I mention that the doors are heavy as hell, so you literally have to hold the swinging door with your butt and pull the gate with you hands.
