I swear the folks from back in the day were straight diesel. Customer Service: OMG.. These people were OUT OF CONTROL!! I called down stairs to let them know that I wanted to take a bath, but there was no plug. They act surprised and tell me they will "see if they can get a plug" for me. WHAT?!?!? Are you serious? So I chill on the bed waiting for a bathtub stopper.. Tick tock, tick tock, an hour passes. I think, it's a Friday, perhaps they forgot about me because they were we so busy, so I call back. I remind them of my request, they tell me "ohh we will send it right up". I'm still waiting for my bathtub plug. The day I was to check out I woke up late and I wanted to get breakfast before it was time for me to go, so I called downstairs and requested to extend my check out time. The lady told me that it was no problem, we could check out at 1pm. Cool that was easy, it was the start of a great day. I come back from breakfast, full and ready to take a nap before it was time for me to drive back home. I patiently wait for the elevator, thanking god that I would only have to wait for it one more time. I get upstairs and my key card doesn't work. Hmm... that's interesting, I checked my watch it was 11:30, the original check out time is 12pm, no they wouldn't change the locks already, would they? So, we tried my friends key, nope it doesn't work. So we go and find a housekeeper, the first one, no English, she gets another one, and she didn't understand a word either. She took me to the a phone, dialed the desk and handed it to me. I have to tell them that I had to called in earlier to extend my check out time. They tell me that I have to go downstairs to get a new key. Honestly, [--]! What was the point of calling and telling them I wanted an extension if they aren't going to write it down. Not to my surprised they called the room around 12:30 to ask if we will be checking out later. Grrrr!!! Radiator/Air Conditioner: We decided to go to SD in the dead of winter, so it was chilly. Not a problem, we are staying in a 3.5 star hotel, central air and heating. NOT!!! Yeah to my surprise, there was a radiator for a heater and a window air conditioner, with paper stuffed in the cracks. I looked all over the room, for the thermostat, or on switch, but found nothing. I finally find the valve on the floor, no temperature gauge, just a valve. Once again, I have to admit that I thought turning a valve and hearing the hmm and soft rumble of the radiator was pretty cool. THAT IS, until I got supper hot in the middle of the night and wanted to it down. So I get out the bed feeling for the valve trying not to burn myself or wake my friend. I go back to bed and it's still hot. So I get up and turn off the radiator, BAD MOVE!! It RuMbLeD and GrUmBlEd and sounding like it was about to combust. My friend was startled by the incredibly loud roar of the radiator. It was ridiculous! Wow wee wow wow.. With all that said, I don't think I will be staying there again, at least not during the winter or the summer. In all it was tolerable, the rooms were clean and the decor, outside of the bathroom, was pretty new. I would suggest this place for long time couples who are just looking for a clean room. But not for a romantic getaway!

Reviews.Title: “The most awful hotel ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: blori
Reviews.Content: The staff was not at all friendly. Very indifferent and not willing to assist in any manner. One elevator was out of service, which leaves one very slow elevator. The tv had horrible reception and poor air conditioner. Watch out for the drastic temperature change in the shower. Bathroom was filthy. Bugs were crawling out of the shower and cockroaches were spotted on the roof. When checking in I was given another guests information, then they had to call to verify that the correct car was assigned to our room. Dont stay here, there are many other options available in the gaslamp quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Valet is Vandals-- Never Again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: phxtopher
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our family Thanksgiving weekend 2008. We did not leave Phoenix until 9 pm and arrived at the Ramada Gaslamp until 3:00 AM. We were NOT aware that the only option for parking was Valet, but the car is located in a "SECURE GARAGE" ony three blocks away! {The SECURE GARAGE IS [--] AND ANYONE CAN FROM THE STREET CAN WALK TO THE CAR!} We agreed handed over are keys and went to bed. At noon, less than 9 hours later, we called for the car. They notified us that the a tire had been slashed and the wind shield wipers were broken. We later found out that the car had been left unlocked and an IPOD was stolen. Management DID NOT give a crap! NO CUSTOMER SERVICE AT ALL! Simply asked" We'll you be checking out?" After talking with VISA and 4 months later, everything FINALLY got resolved. The room was small and NOT big enough for a family! Never again at this DUMP!

Reviews.Title: “Other hotels available”
Reviews.Author: BostonWagga
Reviews.Content: The Ramada Inn is in a wonderful location, Settled right in the Gas lamp district. However, after nearly being scalded in the shower, the air conditioner that didn't work very well and the television that was not tuned made the stay less appealing. I figured they must already know about these issues as they were so dramatic.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of it - the best around for the price”
Reviews.Author: bustermove18
Reviews.Content: Pros - Upgraded us to the Presidential suite to accomodate us - Very obliging valet parking, happy to retrive car/goods as many times as you wished - Location: In the heart of the gaslamp district, but not too noisy - Old school lifts and furnishings, well kept - Friendly staff Cons - Valet parking ($20) not mentioned in the booking

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: mozchick23
Reviews.Content: You pretty much get what you pay for. We chose this place beacuse we were going to a show nearby at the house of blues. The location is great its nearby everything. We got there and we realized we had to valet parking, so we did it wasn't a big deal. When we got there we checked in, we were helped by a lady who was very indifferent a bit of an attitude i would say. When i stay in the hotel usually the case is: the hotel sucks but the service is great or the service sucks and the hotel is great, but unfortuantely this wasn't the case both were bad. This is a historic hotel so u get an actual key not a card to swipe. I'd have to say the old elevator was pretty cool, although it was a bit creepy but it was different than anything else. We get up to our room, and it was like being in an apartment with 2 rooms being seperated by just a wall. Our view was bad, i felt like we were thrown in a corner of the hotel. The rooms were extremely small the only available space was the little space surrounding the bed, there wasn't too much room to move around. The bathrooms were gross, they were very dirty, i was even scared to take a shower and touch any of the nozzles. The walls are pretty thin so you can hear everything going on in the halls. I wouldn't of given it such a bad rating if the staff was a little friendlier and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service imaginable.”
Reviews.Author: backandforth83
Reviews.Content: On evening, I booked a room via the Ramada website for the following night, but when we arrived we were told that our reservation had been made for the previous night and we had been billed as "no-shows." We had had numerous problems with the website and even the clerk at the reception desk admitted that it sounded like a glitch had caused our booking date to revert to the default (i.e. the date I made the booking). Unfortunately he was too honest for his own good, admitting that the hotel had not been booked out the previous night, nor was it booked out upon our arrival, and the rates for both nights were the same. Nonetheless, he needed to ask his supervisor for authorization to check us in that night for no extra charge. The supervisor refused to do this and was extremely impolite and unsympathetic, and despite numerous calls to Ramada we have been unable to secure a refund. They said that we were responsible for ensuring that the date on the confirmation email was correct, even in the event of technical difficulties on their own website. We were down in San Diego for a large gathering of friends and told everyone about our experiences. None of them will be staying at that Ramada or any other Ramada ever again. There was absolutely no reason for them not to put us in a room, considering they had not lost out on any money the night we were "no-shows" (since the hotel was not booked out) and the hotel wasn't full the night we arrived. The only charge we were able to get reversed was $30 on top of our room fee, but they wouldn't tell us what that charge was for, although it wouldn't surprise me if it was a no-show fee. Ramada has a great rate at many locations where I travel and I've had positive experiences before, but given their ineptitude at resolving customer difficulties and owning up to technical problems on their own website, I intend to avoid them permanently.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful historic hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: therndon
Reviews.Content: hotel staff was the most polite and friendly i have ever encountered. they always spoke to me by name and were most helpful whenever i asked for directions.advice on restaurants or places to see. The rooftop lounge area had a spectacular view of san diego. this historic hotel was very authentic, had to get used to the rooms and small showers but it was well worth it. i would definately stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Classic, Hisitoric & Charming.”
Reviews.Author: danger450
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel, as long as you know what you are getting into. I am a single young male, who stayed here for two weeks. I loved the charm of this very historic place, the rooftop cafe is very cool to look at the city from. It is not a massive chain hotel where you are just a number, the people who work here are very nice, and very very helpful. Likely one of the quietest, and most charming hotel in the GASLAMP District. Due to the awesome & historic, but possibly problematic for some folks, the elevator may get int he way fo the elderly, handicapped, and folks who have to keep track of a couple young kids. The old stlye cage elevators (ONCE the fastest in the world by the way!) have a tendancy to "bite" people who are not paying attention. Have some patience, slow down, and take in some history, if you have a brief moment to spare. Within walking distance of everything, both day and night time activities were all done without a car for two weeks. AWESOME ! Yes, I did have a car, but I valeted it when I came home from work, and didn't need it until the next morning!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot recommend this one.”
Reviews.Author: WebstaMom58
Reviews.Content: First glance: What a wonderful old place; great historical details, stunning. Old style 'cage type' elevators. The doors are heavy and difficult to manage and have to be slammed closed most of the time - even at night. The room was of adequate size for a couple. Nothing too fancy, just a standard room with the usual amenities. First night, the shower from the unit above ours leaked into our shower. There was evidence of prior water damage on the access panel in the ceiling. We were already in bed for the night, so chose to report it in the morning. We figured it would stop dripping once the person was done, and it did. Besides, we didn't want work crews in and out all night. When we reported it to the front desk on the way out for breakfast, we were asked if it was ok for someone to go in while we were out. No problem, we planned to be out all day. By that night, it did not appear to have been corrected, nothing was said to us by the front desk, no sign they'd even been there, nothing. After that, the woman at the front desk would see us come into the lobby and would keep her head down as we passed through, to ensure there was no eye contact. There is LOTS of street noise at night from surrounding clubs and the next room. Dare I not mention the smog that blows in through the windows which have portable a/c units in them, even in January. We blocked most of it out the second night with a bath towel, closed the lined drapes and moved furniture against them to keep it out as much as possible. I often save "sample" packages of shampoo, etc I receive to use during travel. I apparently had 'missed' the trash bucket when throwing it away that morning. It was still on the floor, despite the "cleaning" person already "cleaning" the room. Which means, the floor was not even swept. It left me wondering what else wasn't done. Fearing for our safety from the air quality of the room, we checked out the next day. (we booked for four nights- left after the second.) We figured if we were being ignored by the front desk for reporting the leaking shower, what would they do if we complained about carbon monoxide coming into our room from the streets below. ?? We were on the 8th floor. Since we'd pre-paid for only the first night, we chose to pay the $50.00 "early out" penalty fee and go elsewhere. Honestly, even if we'd pre-paid the entire balance, we'd have left and attempted to retrieve a refund later. The hotel sends out email surveys to it's customers. When I wrote these comments in the survey, I was offered a discount for my next stay. Even at a discounted rate, you could not get me to stay there again, sorry to say.

Reviews.Title: “Creepy, bizarre, and more...”
Reviews.Author: mishabisha
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel in May 2008 for one night. I have to say, it is the most disturbing hotel either of us have ever stayed in. First of all, for those who aren't familiar, it is a VERY old building (it was opened in 1913 as the Hotel St. James) and not much has changed in the almost 100 years since then. The parking situation was terrible; there was a pay lot next door to the hotel but it's expressly NOT for hotel guests. You must have a valet park your car for you and it often gets parked several blocks away. We never did see exactly where he parked my car but it took him somewhere around 15 minutes to bring it to us when we checked out. The front desk staff was interesting. They were training a new hire when we checked in and we were somewhat ignored while his boss showed him the ropes of checking us in. Understandable, but a little irritating. Like I mentioned, it's a very old hotel. The elevators are tiny and claustrophobic and you better be strong enough to pull the old, heavy metal doors because they're not automatic. It felt pretty unsafe on the ride up to our room. Once we got in the room, it was tiny and cramped with barely enough room to maneuver around the bed. We had a connecting room with people we didn't know staying next door and the walls were paper thin. It takes a lot of noise to really bother me but we could hear people sniffling next door. We heard strange noises outside our door all night long, including a few instances where someone was standing directly outside our door in the middle of the night. We could see them staring at our door when we looked out the peephole. Needless to say, we didn't sleep well thinking that some weirdo was stalking us. The room doors are old and don't seem like they'd hold up against anyone who really wanted to get inside. It wasn't super expensive but wasn't worth the price we paid. We definitely wouldn't stay there again. It's great to be in the gaslamp but I'd suggest paying a little more money to stay someplace newer.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Spicymeatball
Reviews.Content: THIS PLACE IS INFESTED WITH BED BUGS!!!! DO NOT STAY HERE!!! The government HAD this hotel on it's list of places that accept its per diem. We checked in late and awoke to HUNDREDS of blood sucking bed bugs crawling all over our pillows and sheets. There were blood spots all over the bed. The people that worked in the hotel came to the room and said, VERBATIM, "Ew. Sorry. Yeah, those are bed bugs. We'll move you to another room and take care of you." They moved us to another room where we found MORE bed bugs. When I asked them to sterilize our things, they gave us grief. The people that work here are not very accommodating AT ALL. We were charged FULL PRICE and were COVERED in bites for weeks. It was misery. We were so disturbed by this that we didn't sleep for DAYS. When we got home, we freaked out about the possibility of bringing them home with us. We RE-Sterilized everything. Luckily, we haven't seen any...but if we do...OMG. We were utterly disgusted when we got the bill (though the gov't was paying) and it was FULL PRICE. Not ONLY did they NOT take care of us like they said, they ruined some of our clothes, we had freaking BED BUGS and they were not friendly when we very kindly and patiently asked them to help us out with our stuff. This place is an absolute nightmare and should be torn down. The government is now taking it off the list of places they will send their employees. The elevator is so inconvenient and takes FOREVER. HATE THIS PLACE.

Reviews.Title: “The horrible staff overshadowed anything positive”
Reviews.Author: stuckinAZ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ramada along with 20 or so of my out-of-town guests who came to San Diego for my wedding. As if I didn’t have enough going on to be stressed about, we had multiple problems with the hotel including a tub that backed up whenever we or anyone else on our floor took a shower; this caused our room to smell of sewage and left us without a shower to use. Being that the hotel was old and things like that just happen, I would have been somewhat understanding had the staff tried to accommodate us. Be ware – if you stay here and have any problems, the staff is completely incompetent and will not assist you in any meaningful way. There wasn’t senior management available to discuss our issues and the front desk manager that was there basically said he couldn’t do anything for us. Other issues included our guests being charged incorrect rates, unauthorized charges to guests’ credit cards, and the hotel telling guests that the airport shuttle would take over an hour to pick them up from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff and not trustable with prepaid reservations”
Reviews.Author: MoNo79
Reviews.Content: Ok, it's central, they can have that. If you are looking for a place close to nightclubs and dining areas this is as close as you get. It's situated in San Diego's Gas Lamp district. However our stay was terrible. Even as we physically made our reservations the day before we were to check in and had paid, they managed to get it all wrong and the rates to the room increased and we didn't get the rooms we booked at all. The staff was acting very rude (part from one guy that seemed embarrased of the whole thing). The rooms we got wasn't even clean.

Reviews.Title: “great experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: lolaaz
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I were on a quick romantic getaway for the weekend and found this hotel absolutely charming!!! We both travel extensivley, domestic and international and were still quite pleased. The rooms are small but have character to spare, the elevator is certainly not swift but who cares its an old hotel that sees value in history. Just relax and enjoy. Th rooftop porch is beautifull with an amazing view and the resteraunt is pretty good too. Everything you could want is within walking distance as are the trolley and a very good public bus system. If the noise is bothersome than you shouldn't be staying in the Gaslamp at all and the hotel has you sign an acknowledgment that you are in an "entertainment zone" so you cant say you weren't warned. The staff was wonderful, we couldn't have been happier

Reviews.Title: “Goood value for the money”
Reviews.Author: KateFromCA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in mid-June 2008. I chose this hotel because I was looking to stay in Gaslamp Quarter and this hotel was the least expensive at the time. The rooms were very small (reminded me of San Francisco or London hotels) and the shower was quite tiny as well (I am 5 foot 2 and could not move around in the shower). But, everything worked just fine and the room was very clean. The bed was comfortable and I slept very well both nights. The air conditioner was a window unit that made noise even when turned off (probably filtered the noise from the street). It actually helped me sleep because I could not hear the noise from bars all around Gaslamp Quarter. Note that anywhere in the Gaslamp Quarter is loud - you don't stay there to relax; you stay there so you can go out at night and not have to drive back to the hotel. Parking is valet-only, at $20 per day (plus tips of course) which included in-and-out privileges. I found valet experience to be quite good and the price is reasonable for a downtown hotel. They parked the car somewhere off site and asked for a ten-minute lead time to retrieve it. That is not a long time to wait for a valet and they actually ask you to call in advance! Very nice of them. Regarding prior reviews of laptops being stolen from the truck, who leaves laptops in a truck of a valeted car? And for that matter, who gives valet a key that can open the trunk? Be reasonable and your travel experience will be better for it.

Reviews.Title: “VALET THIEVES!!!! Management doesnt even care”
Reviews.Author: TRVLR08
Reviews.Content: I am on a mission to share my experience incase I can help anyone from the same thing happening at this dump in the future. This location has no available parking and you must valet unless you park at someone elses off site location. May 30, 2008 a friday night I regretfully stayed here last minute. (the rooms are crap as well, thankfully it was only one night)Saturday at noon I was too busy watching the valet forget to set me E break and have the car roll into another, that i did not notice my laptop and laptop bag and a other items within it were all STOLEN out of my trunk. FOR LESS THAN 24 HOURS THIS CHEAP/CRAPPY HOTEL HAD MY KEYS AND CAR AND WHEN RETURNED, ITEMS ARE MISSING. DOESN;T TAKE A ROCKET SCIENTIST TO FIGURE OUT WHO MAY HAVE BEEN WORKING AND DO SOMETHING ABOUT IT. And to make matters worse, NOTHING was done NOTHING!!!!!!!!! One manager passed me to another to another with no answers finally saying I will hear from the GM. BUT i NEVER did. People, there are a handfull of Crappy cheap last minute hotels, DO NOT CHOOSE THIS ONE unless you are asking to be royally screwed!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Love & Hate”
Reviews.Author: Cuching
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay here because it was a hotel with some character and history and a great location. I was given a dark postage stamp sized room with no outside windows. Although the hotel was basically full, I was upgraded to a suite on the top floor, thanks to the very nice staff, Jacob, Stacey, and (I guess) the manager. Still a bit noisy, not everything worked, but the view was magnificent. The elevators were worthy of a review of their own. It would be perfect if the hotel was renovated and they had a quicker, larger alternative elevator that didn't attack you and charm you at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: ilive2roam
Reviews.Content: The word for this hotel would be "charming". I recently stayed there for a convention and overall it was satisfactory. The elevator was so slow that we usually took the steps (one was broken). The staff friendly. The restruant next door is amazing. The location is great. The rooms were small, the shower filled with water during my shower, as did the sink. Since I didn't spend much time in my room, not a big deal. The room was clean, the bed comfortable. If you are looking for a room close to everything, that you won't be spending time in, at an affordable rate this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Rooms Facing the Front of the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Euradiohead
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have stayed at this Hotel 3 times before and never had a problem until this last stay. We choose the Ramada because of the price and location. Hotel could be more updated, I guess, but the building is very old so I just let that slide. The elevator, for example, is very old but also interestingly historic. Anyway, the only bad experience I had was Valentine's weekend 2008. I always have read negative reviews of good hotels in the Gaslamp District due simply to the noise of nearby clubs and bars. Well, as I signed for the room, I had to initial by certain sentences of this little contract that where highlighted. One stuck out where the hotel pretty much said "We are not responsible for your dissatisfaction with your room due to outside noise," or something close to that. Having stayed there a few times before, I honestly don't remember ever seeing that before. I didn't sweat it since there were no clubs immediately nearby, so I signed away. We go up to the room. Like anyone, I look out to see our view and it's a view of the front street, 6th street. Never had a room in the front of the hotel before. The building across was in the process of being torn down, I thought, "Oh, great... this is why I had to sign that noise clause" but luckily the workers had the weekend off. It wasn't till 10:45pm when we got back to the hotel that we heard the loud Jungle music coming from who knows where down stairs. We were on the 6th floor but this music was loud. It had to be coming from the club on the corner. I could not believe how loud it was! Luckily we were, ahem, drunk enough to passout and not endure too much of the racket. The hotel was also kind enough to bless us with a 2pm checkout. I would still stay at the Ramada, I just will never stay in a room facing the front street.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms, old elevator, but for $88 a night I can't complain”
Reviews.Author: spideymph
Reviews.Content: I booked the Ramada Gaslamp Hotel to attend a concert at the House of Blues (2 blocks down) through Hotwire, weekday, for $88 including tax. Hotwire has it as a 3 star, but it is more like a 2.5 stars. The facility was an old hotel with tiny hallways, a very old lift/elevator, but it is centrally located close to Petco, Convention Center, and Horton Plaza. The standard room had a nice soft and clean bed, yet there wasnt more than 5 feet of space on both sides of the bed. The restroom sink is outside the bathroom and in fron of the bed, with a shower stall, no bathtub, and the toilet, pretty standard. The room was a bit old but clean and there was not a bad scent. There we many cable channels on the TV which was good, and they had free internet service. $20 valet parking services with in/out privileges was not bad. Overall I think it is an ok hotel considering the price if you are staying for 1-2 nights. I dont think the hotel is kid friendly because of the limited space.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of Scary”
Reviews.Author: haithgirl
Reviews.Content: The experience was a scary one for me. I'm not saying this to be mean. It's the truth. The layout of the rooms themselves were extremely odd. I don't know if it was just our room or what, but it was strange. The hotel is old. There are some hotels that, with age, gain character and charm. This isn't necessarily one of those hotels . There were small bugs on our sink, which were visible to the naked eye without close inspection. The elevator is fun, but too small. The view from the roof is amazing at night. I will definitely say that. The valet service is slow and understaffed. At first, I kept reminding myself it wasn't their fault they were understaffed, but then the valets themselves turned out to be rude and totally unattentive to all of the guests waiting. I definitely had a problem with that. I really hate to write so many negative things about this hotel, but I feel like the staff did nothing to contribute to any type of good experience during the entire length of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, great location, small, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: silvalex
Reviews.Content: I read some of the poor reviews so I didn’t know what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised by a clean room and nice staff. I received a call shortly after entering the room to make sure everything in the room was satisfactory. Yes, everyone, the parking is $18, wow that's not a big deal in any downtown/metro area I've been to. Try parking in Miami, its $50, LA is $30. I was happy to have unlimited valet for $18, that is a good price for parking. Yes the rooms are small, good for a romantic couple, probably not good for your whole family to shack up in one room. The rooms are clean, and have high ceilings. The elevators are slow, but they are neat (old loft style with a cage). Apparently, when the hotel was built in 1913, they were the fastest elevators in the world and people came from all over to marvel at their speed. Hahah, they are really slow, but again, interesting and very cool if you enjoy antique construction.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: jodle77
Reviews.Content: Chose to stay at the Ramada in the Gaslamp Quarter due to its great location and affordable price. Absolutely loved the experience. The rooftop patio has great views, staff was friendly and helpful, and the room was comfortable and clean. Would love to stay here again and would suggest to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Scary Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: mcleas
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel as an affordable place to stay in the Gaslamp Quarter and I'll never go cheap again! I heard a strange rustling in the bathroom and when I opened the shower curtain, I found about 100 little cockroaches crawling around!! Although they did move me to a different room, I received no credits, no refunds and no apologies after many desperate attempts to get something. The historic charm of this hotel did not make up for the most disgusting experience I have ever had while on the road.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: Agibson00
Reviews.Content: I was really disappointed with how rude the front desk staff was. I expected a much better experience with the Ramada name. My hotel key didn't work the first time (not a big deal, that's happened at other hotels too) so I lugged two suitcases in the tiny elevator back down to the front desk. Then my second set of keys didn't work either. I found a phone in the 5th floor hallway and asked if a bellboy or someone could bring a third set of keys up so I didn't have to make the trip with the suitcases again. I was told no, I would have to return to the lobby. Luckily, my third set of keys worked, but there was no apology given. In fact, it was almost the opposite, like I was inconveniencing THEM!! The room was TINY, not like the picture showed on their website. The shower dripped all night and there was a really strange smell in the hallway. We did like the bar/restaurant attached to the hotel. That was a perk. But we didn't like it enough to ever stay there again! We will not be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you'd expect”
Reviews.Author: Momof2prettygirls
Reviews.Content: If you do your research ahead of time, you'd know that this is a old hotel with small rooms. They are pretty clean and look updated. For the great location and relatively low price, it's a good place to stay. Had no noise problems even on Saturday night, elevators weren't as slow as everyone says. Restaurant next door is great and cheap for breakfast - we walked everywhere and couldn't find someplace better. Definitely check out the roof - better yet, walk to Ralph's grocery 3-4 blocks away first and grab some adult beverages and snacks to take up there.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Danley
Reviews.Content: DONT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!! This place is so deceiving, it is not a historic charm, it is horrible!!!!! We where in town for 3 days on a mini vacation, we almost didnt make it through the first night, we where making up every excuse to leave that night, like we saw a late night movie just so we would only have to be there to sleep that night. The air conditioning unit was practicualy taped to the window, it smelt like a dead old lady, the furniture looked like they got it from a flea market, and lets just say I did not let my husband or myself walk barefoot in the room!!!!!! The serice sucked!!!! The valet was never at the front, it took forever to get the car. The next day we canceled the rest of our stay and lost quit a bit of money just to stay some where else.

Reviews.Title: “Take nothing for granted at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: digger718
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel for price and courtesy shuttle. Stayed one night, Saturday. We are a family of 3, two adults and one child who were looking to get an early start to our vacation. Arrived a little before 10:00pm and began attempting to contact hotel for shuttle pick up. After 15 minutes of intermittent calling without answer, finally got a live person. I was quickly and none too elequintly told that the shuttle was not running and I would have to go pay for the airport shuttle. At $13.00 a person I was instantly looking at being out about $40.00 plus the ever so eagerly awaited tip for the shuttle driver. Having never seen anything in writing about reimbursements or back up arrangements to the shuttle, I did what any half travel wise person would do. I took a taxi which I knew would only be $10-15, including tip. Being less than the airport shuttle I felt confident that hotel management would at least negotiate some form of compensation. The actual taxi with tip was $15 for all three of us. Upon arriving I was told there was no management available and it would have to wait until morning. We got to the front desk at about 8:00 am and again were told there was no management available until the afternoon. As we were wanting to sight see we checked our bags and closed our account to return in the afternoon. Upon our return we were told that management was available, but in the back office. After several minutes of asking to speak with management, I had to flat out tell the front desk to go and get the person. After noticing that my account had been closed out he immediately stopped attempting to work a resolution. He continously stated that I had violated a policy he would never produce in writing by taking a taxi. I am currently working with Ramada Guest services to address the situation. Not so much in the dollar amount, but as to the hotel policies. As far as the room and hotel conditions. I would rate them fair to poor. Cracked, chip tiles, deteriorated looking showers and general smell similar to a musty basement. For the money there are far better hotels in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: czito143
Reviews.Content: I drove all the way down from LA on Valentine's Day to stay here. When I arrived I had to search for Valet for 10 minutes and found him in the bar. He proceeded to take my luggage out and take me to the front. I gave them my name and all they did was slide me a piece of paper and say "We don't have a room for you" I asked why that I had a reservation and the front desk BOY said "the people who had your room didn't leave, what do you want us to do throw their stuff on the street?" Um yeah thats exactly what I expect when someone has a reservation and they have over stayed their visit. Even worse was the fact that HAD THEY CALLED ME AHEAD OF TIME, they could have saved me 3 hours of searching for a room in downtown SD till 11 pm at night. They were rude and offered no appologies, the hotel smelled like urine when I walked in and the valet is no where to be found. Had I taken the train like I had originally planned I would have been completely stranded in a city where I knew no one alone at 11pm. I received no calls to offer an apology after the fact AND they just fouoght with me and hotels.com because after all this they still charged me for the room!!!! UNBELIEVABLE! You better believe their corporate office will get wind of this. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: amlphx
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was nice and clean and in a great location, but I was immediately charged upon checkin which was a little strange. Not only was I immediately charged, but it was the wrong amount! They overcharged me by $300.00! I had to transfer money into the account and when I asked them about it, the girl at the front desk was argumentative and rude. The entire stay I had to constantly ask them when they would rectify the problem. Upon checking out our bill was still not correct and when I showed them a copy of the confirmation and told them that this was unacceptable, I was again made to feel as if I was annoying them with my simple request to fix this costly mistake. In the end I had to contact the head manager and he did fix it, but it really did put a damper on what was supposed to be a relaxing trip on a budget. The front desk staff was overall very rude and standoffish, but the maintenance staff, housekeeping, bell boys and room service staff were exceptional. The place was clean and the free high speed wireless was great especially since I had to check my bank statements online and transfer money due to their mistake. If you stay here, bring a laptop and check your statement daily. Upon checking out thoroughly check your bill. It took them 4 days to fix their mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: bravofamily
Reviews.Content: The quality of the service at the front desk was hit and miss but overall average. We reserved a two bedroom (connected room). The elevator IS slow and the hotel might not be very handicapped friendly. The building is old but the furnishings, carpets and overall design is updated and fresh. If you don't mind stairs, there's also a rooftop that offers great views and nobody was ever up there which made it nice and private. HOT TIP::: If you want to bypass the elevator (which is the bigest pain at this hotel) , the lady at the front desk told me to reserve a lower floor next time!!

Reviews.Title: “It more than an OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MysticKid
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as I wanted to see exactly what the Gaslight District (and wanted to save $ vs. the convention hotel) provided even though my convention was at a waterfront hotel and a 15 minute walk. The stay was very good. Directly in back of the hotel on 5th street and surrounding area there have to 40-50 restaurants of many types and variation of every ethnic food. While the requisite area includes a couple of Starbucks, there are also a couple of small tea house sand attached to the hotel is Brian's which was a very nice small restaurant that goes breakfast thru dinner. Lobby and check in was very good. About a $12 cab ride from the airport. One of the 2 elevators was not in service and while the elevator is charming it is very slow. Still to walk down 4 flights of stairs every day is no big deal. Wifi is OK. They also have 2 computers on the 2nd floor for guests to use. Room was good , not great. Small, but clean and nice. bathroom was shower only but very nice. iron and ironing board in room was convenient. For a visiting biz person, the room was fine, quiet as I had a back room and most importantly, it was clean. Loved the gaslight district from walking out of it every morning and stopping at the local coffee shops to stopping for a drink on the way back. Very cool location brought this hotel into a very good visit. Checking out to grab a cab, there was a Ramada bus that whisked me to the airport and I saved $12 for the company ! Hotel costs for @$100 a night for the Ramada versus the convention hotel that was reduced to $219 was a major advantage .

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: bilinvic
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous booking this hotel after reading these reviews, but since there way a city-wide convention during our planned weekend in SD, I was willing to book anyways, wanting a downtown/Gaslamp area hotel. Upon arrival, I was pleased to see the main foyer/reception was quite nice, almost elaborate. I quickly noticed it was very clean. The staff were pleasant and very helpful, it took no time at all to get checked in. We were on the first floor, so the elevators were not an issue, although I did want to check them out later. Our room was indeed small, but very nice. In an hotel that's about a hundred years old, you have to expect quirks. The room had a very european feel to it, and it was also very clean, the decor and character was quite nice. The 12 foot ceilings open the room up, complete with a ceiling fan that provided good air flow without having to listen to the slight hum of the in-window air conditioning. The bathroom was clean and updated...no complaints there except it didn't have a bathtub for my wife. That's the only surprise we had. The roof top patio was excellent...and also very clean with awesome views of San Diego and the surrounding areas. Yes, the elevators were slow, but unique, which further amplified the old character of this hotel. Overall, I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing for a decent, clean place to stay within the Gaslamp District. I was impressed with the service and hospitality the staff exhibited. In fact, my wife and I have agreed, the next time we come to visit SD, we will be staying at the Ramada St. James Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: calvin217
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in Sept. The rooms were OK; separate rooms separated by a door. A little small, but a nice set-up for two adult friends wanting their own bed. The hotel tried to charge a much higher rate for the second night despite their original quote (luckily we had the original internet printout). But the worst was the valet experience. Not only do they charge $18/night, but when I left my car with the valet the first night, they specifically told me the $18 was good for 24 hrs. So when I picked up the car 20 hrs later, the valets then told me that I'd be charged another $18 because the clock reset at the 2pm checkout. They were willing to bring in management; I was running late to the airport, so I didn't have time to argue, but I was pissed to say the least. Two different instances of bait and switch - stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, expensive price, tough to find valets”
Reviews.Author: sam_the_dog
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because the Hotel Del Coronado was booked for the conference I was attending, I paid $196 and got a clean room, overpriced, not modern, but clean. It had an iron, and a computer connected to the internet with a printer on the 2nd floor. However, the valet was not around when I needed to go. Normally this would have been fine but I was late. The man behind the counter was kind enough to leave the front desk un-attended as others waited to find my car and get me going. Much appreciated. I wish his superiors had thought to put more than one person at the front desk for everyone else's sake. I am still trying to get an itemized copy of my bill from the management and am finding no love. I wouldn't stay here again, but it would have been acceptable for a $60/night place.

Reviews.Title: “Roach Motel”
Reviews.Author: mattbert
Reviews.Content: Room was dank, dark, and musty, with exposed pipes on the ceiling and walls. Woke up one morning to find a cockroach in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Rooftop views”
Reviews.Author: kellilynn81
Reviews.Content: We went with a group of friends for a 30th birthday during St Patty's day. We stayed in the 2 suites located on the top floor. Our rooms were a good size for all of us. Spa tubs and a full size kitchen, huge TV in the front room. VERY relaxing. We had access to the rooftop which over looked the Gaslamp quarters, I believe we spent most of our nights up there. You could see the St Patty's festival and it overlooks the Petco Stadium. We absolutely enjoyed our stay there except for 2 things.... 1) the elevator....VERY VERY slow, they were once the fastest running elevator now they could be the slowest running elevators. But our group liked to be competitve so we would race up the stairs to our room on the tenth floor. And after a few drinks at their very friendly restaurant on site your oxygen level was tested :) 2) The thin doors... you could hear everything if you slept in the front room. I was actually in the back room so I heard nothing but the other members of our group couldn't sleep. Overall. stay here if you go with a group of people. The suites are worth it.

Reviews.Title: “nasty!”
Reviews.Author: hmendoza
Reviews.Content: nasty! the elevator was creepy looked like there was barf on the walls...got to my room and it was nasty...smelled all musty....didn't even want to sit on the pot...didnt take a shower cause the shower was gross...didn't even want to brush my teeth in the room...i can't believe i paid $139 for a damn room....paid another $18 for valet parking and it wasnt even really valet parking! they just handed me the keys the next morning and i had to walk to the parking lot and get my own car!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a couple of nights.”
Reviews.Author: UAtraveller
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay through priceline ($99) and were a little worried after reading previous reviews. It is a hotel build in 1913 with lots of original charm. Once the tallest bulding south of San francisco it had the worlds fastest elevators. Cool eh !. They still have the originals with the gates and all. Only thing missing is the operator to help keep the door and gate open while you manouver your luggage. Our room was smaller with 12 ft ceilings. Everything was clean and modern. It is what I expected from a Ramada. It is not the Rennaissance. European Charm for sure. Location is superb for walking to the many choices in the gaslamp area. Worth what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: klscaz
Reviews.Content: We booked this through Hotwire. It was supposed to be rated 4 stars. They have since downgraded it to 2.5 stars. We relocated to another hotel after one night at a significant loss but were much happpier. Hotwire gave us 100 hot dollars for the inconvenience. The rooms were smaller than our cruise ship cabin. There were paint splatters everywhere. No place to store shoes or luggage. The fixtures where from 1980. The sink was cracked. We both bumped our head on the towel bar which is directly over the toilet. There was a window air conditioner resulting in air leaks into the room. It was party central in Gaslamp Quarter. Even though we were on the 7th floor, we could not get to sleep until the bars closed at 2 AM due to the noise in the streets. The old elevator, while charming did not accomodate today's large luggage. On the plus side, the staff was nice and we had a good breakfast next door at Brians.

HotelInfo.Name: Ramada Inn & Suites Gaslamp/Convention Center
HotelInfo.Address: 830 6th Avenue, San Diego, CA 92101 (Formerly Hotel St. James)
